snippet: House Republicans combined two ill-conceived health care measures into a single bill and passed it.
abstract: Editorial criticizes House Republicans for passing a bill in March that repeals the Independent Payment Advisory Board, a major cost-control measure in the health care reform law, and imposes restrictions on medical malpractice awards; urges the Senate to reject or bury the legislation.
lead_paragraph: House Republicans combined two ill-conceived health care measures into a single bill and passed it.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
